snippet: The deployment will double the number of Americans meant to train and advise Iraqi and Kurdish forces as they plan a major offensive against Islamic State fighters who have poured into Iraq from Syria.
abstract: Pres Obama authorizes deployment of additional 1,500 troops to Iraq, doubling current US military presence in country; says troops will not be put into combat but will train and advise Iraqi military as they plan offensive against Islamic State fighters; also plans to ask Congress for $5 billion for military operations in Middle East.

byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and MICHAEL D. SHEAR

lead_paragraph: The deployment will double the number of Americans meant to train and advise Iraqi and Kurdish forces as they plan a major offensive against Islamic State fighters who have poured into Iraq from Syria.

headline.main: Obama to Send 1,500 More Troops to Assist Iraq
headline.print_headline: Obama to Send 1,500 Troops to Assist Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
